summary: This is a discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, providing an index of materials (Bates-stamped SDNY_GM_00000001 through SDNY_GM_00012841) being disclosed pursuant to Rule 16. It details a vast array of seized records including financial, travel, communication, and corporate documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and requests reciprocal discovery from the defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The document is a discovery letter providing materials related to her prosecution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Frequently referenced as the subject of the seized records, including his immigration, travel, financial, and communication records.

persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: The discovery materials extensively document their shared travel, financial, communication, and corporate records, indicating a deep investigative focus on their association.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery on Maxwell's behalf.
Cohen is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery on Maxwell's behalf.

Kahn is listed as an executor of Epstein's estate, indicating a fiduciary relationship.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Discovery Disclosure to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally provides a massive trove of discovery materials (over 12,800 items) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
U.S. Virgin Islands (referenced in corporate records for Laurel Inc, Maple Inc, Nautilus, Inc.)
keyFacts: The government disclosed a vast discovery index containing 12,841 Bates-stamped items (SDNY_GM_00000001 through SDNY_GM_00012841) related to the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

The discovery includes extensive records on Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell: financial (bank, PayPal, Venmo), travel (airline, flight manifests 1991-2013), communication (email, phone, social media), and corporate documents.
Materials were obtained from Epstein's estate executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, indicating cooperation or compliance from the estate.
The letter outlines the government's policy on plea deals, stating it will oppose a sentencing reduction if a guilty plea is not entered six weeks prior to trial or before 3500 material is provided.
A significant portion of the materials, including search warrants, financial records, and flight manifests, are designated as 'Confidential' under a protective order.
